articles.title: भीम आर्मी चीफ चंद्रशेखर जयपुर में गिरफ्तार, कोविड सहायकों की आवाज बुलंद करने पहुंचे थे राजस्थान
articles.description: Rajasthan news : भीम आर्मी चीफ चंद्रशेखर  को राजस्थान पुलिस ( Chandra shekhar arrested by Rajasthan police ) ने गिरफ्तार किया है। चंद्रशेखर जयपुर कोविड सहायकों (Covid-19) के धरने का समर्थन करने पहुंचे थे।

articles.title: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav like Mughal emperors who oppressed their kin for power: BJP MP Dinesh Lal Yadav Nirahua
articles.description: Nirahua, who had lost to Akhilesh Yadav in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections from Azamgarh, won the bypolls held for the seat last month. He defeated SP candidate Dharmendra Yadav in the opposition party's bastion. The MP said the SP chief had smelt defeat in the …
articles.content: Newly elected BJP MP from Azamgarh Dinesh Lal Yadav 'Nirahua' on Sunday likened the Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav with the Mughal emperors, who he said oppressed their kin for the sake of powe… [+3136 chars]

articles.title: Above dozen terrorist launch pads active across LoC: Intel report
articles.description: As per intelligence inputs, a top government official citing intelligence input said, nearly 200 terrorists are waiting on these launch pads in PoK to infiltrate into Jammu and Kashmir. The official said there has been a few instances of successful infiltrati…

articles.author: ET Bureau
articles.title: Kolkata Police issues lookout circular for suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma
articles.description: Sharma was summoned twice by two police stations, Narkeldanga and Amherst Street in Kolkata, for her alleged remarks and she sought time from Narkeldanga Police station. The police summoned her under section 41 of the Code of Criminal Procedure.
articles.content: The Kolkata Police issued a look out circular for the suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on Saturday, a day after the Supreme Court held her responsible for country-wide repercussions following … [+1378 chars]

articles.description: India Business News: NEW DELHI: Housing sales in Delhi-NCR fell 19 per cent to 15,340 units in April-June compared to the previous quarter on lower demand due to rise in p.
